body: Please see http://wiki.apache.org/thrift/HowToContribute for contributing patches back to Thrift. We currently do not accept patches back this way from github.

Fix was committed to upstream svn.  Closing since pull requests are not used in the thrift project currently.
comitted on trunk!
this change seems to have broken the visual studio (windows) build
I have a fix for it. Do you accept pull requests on Github or does it need to go through jira/svn?

If you have a pull request for trunk and grant full License to ASF, just proceed.

However, the portal for handling issues and patches is here: http://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/THRIFT

Could you please create a Ticket within JIRA, as described here
http://thrift.apache.org/docs/HowToContribute

and add the link to this issue here?

thanks!

two pull requests on https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/THRIFT-1023
next patch there will be committed!

Thanks for your answer.  

I know my lib/phpsf is a problem because the code is exactly the same as lib/php, but lib/php doesn't use Namespace as Symfony 2 or PHP 5.3 does.
So it is a real problem for being PHP 5.3 fully compliant. But I know the problem is to maintain 2 times the same code.

I will create a ticket, I hope this week, before I need to merge my work with trunk.

Best regards.  

Xavier Hausherr | CTO | OverBlog

Thank you for issuing a pull request for your patch. Currently we do not accept pull requests from Github, If you could please attach the patch to THRIFT-2227 we would be glad to review. Appreciate the help
@jfarrell I submitted this on both JIRA and GitHub as with all my other patches.  Hosting these on GitHub helps me track which patches have not merged upstream.
@jfarrell submitted a patch both on JIRA and via pull request.
@andrewgaul thank you for the work, greatly appreciated.
Gotcha. I can fix this, but to clarify: the optional field that has an explicitly-specified default should return true from its `IsSet...()` method, yes?

Yes, as agreed upon in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/THRIFT-1528

Meanwhile, I did some more testing. 
I get errors with IDL like this

```
struct ConfigOption {
  1 : required string OptionID
  2 : optional string Display
  3 : required OptionEntries Entries
  4 : optional string SelectedID
}

typedef list< ConfigOption>  ConfigOptions

struct ConfigGroup {
  1 : required string GroupID,
  2 : optional string Display,
  4 : optional ConfigOptions Options,
  5 : optional bool IsError
}
```

It gives me

```
..\gen-go\S4P\ttypes.go:2211: cannot use &tSlice (type *[]*ConfigOption) as type *ConfigOptions in assignment
```
Does it make sense if you fix the two typos "error reading set **being**: %s" while you're at it? Just look for ReadSetBegin() and ReadListBegin(). Should of course read "begin", not "being".

I'll take a look at the test case you listed above when I fix the optional-default issue.

How would you suggest adding it as a formal test case? Or maybe I should just incorporate it into one of the example files?

And I'm totally happy to fix the typos, sure!

Another one:

```
struct SomeEntry {
  2 : required string ID
  6 : optional IntArray SeriesIDs
}
```

produces

```
..\gen-go\S4P\ttypes.go:3398: invalid indirect of v (type int32)
```

in the writeField6() method.

```
typedef list< i32>  IntArray
```
I agree regarding the test cases, as long as we don't touch the test.thrift IDL files, etc. There are already some tests in lib/go/test, I think that's a good place.

>  though I don't see a full test suite to validate beyond that.

Oh yes, there is one. I'm not sure if Go is fully connected, but `make check` should at least run the test suite.

ah, yeah, `make check` was problematic because my dev system doesn't have many of the necessary languages installed. I'll take a closer look at the source and make sure that I don't cause any regressions in Go-specific tests. Maybe I'll add a few (e.g., your test cases) if there aren't any tests established yet.
PS: all of this makes me long for the simplicity of protobufs :) But I really appreciate your careful attention, as I am flying blind to a certain extent here. Thanks again.
